column5: Looking to try and pickle a pike that I plan on catching. Have any of you ever pickled any fish

I'd like to phone a friend. On a more helpful note here is my pickled fish recipe. I use cheap white wine and put a section of garlic and 1/2 of a jalapeno in each jar.Cold Pickled Fish(Northern Pike or Other White Fish )Note – This is a cold fish brine recipe – Do NOT use heat for any of the stepsIngredientsNorthern or other white fish. – As much as you want to make1qt. Sweet white wine.1qt. White vinegar½ cup White SugarOnions ( White or Yellow )½ cup Pickling Salt2TBS. Pickling spiceDried Red Pepper flakes-optionalGarlic – optionalHot Peppers – optional Step 1 – Filet fish and cut into bite size pieces. You can leave the bones in the fillet or remove larger ribs. . The bones will dissolve as it cures. Step 2 – Mix ½ qt. vinegar with ½ qt wine and ½ cup pickling salt. Loosely pack fish pieces in quart glass ( Mason ) jar. Fill jar with mixture to completely cover the fish. Refrigerate jars for 5 days. Once or twice each day rotate, spin, and gently shake each jar for 1-2 minutes.Step 3 – At the end of the 5th day, remove fish from the jars. Rinse fish with cold water for 5 minutes and drain. Place fish in large pan with cold water and let stand for 1 Hr. Drain fish again.Step 4 – Mix remaining vinegar & wine with sugar and pickling spice. Red pepper flakes, garlic, hot peppers and bay leaf can be added to taste. Return fish to quart jars laying fish and onions ( If desired ) in alternating layers. When jar is ½ full, add mixture until the fish is covered. Add fish & onions until the jar is nearly full. Fill the jar with mixture to fully cover the fish. Rotate, spin, gently shake. Note – You can add other ingredients during this stage as well – such as Garlic or peppers.Step 5 – Return jars to the refrigerator for at least 1 week for best flavor. Each day remove and rotate, spin and gently shake for 1 minute.Step 6 – After 1 week, eat fish as desired – Excellent with butter or saltine crackers.Note – Store fish in refrigerator for up to 3 months ( If yours last that long )
